New Records: The Dodgers matched the MLB postseason record with 33 consecutive scoreless innings.
Jack Flaherty pitched seven scoreless innings with six strikeouts.
Key Match Events: The game was a shutout with the Dodgers winning 9-0.
Mookie Betts hit a three-RBI double in the fourth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets were focused on containing Shohei Ohtani.
The Dodgers' pitching strategy could influence future games.
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers' manager highlighted the team's strong performance.
The win brought the Dodgers closer to the World Series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played under ideal weather conditions.
The Dodgers matched the 1966 Orioles' record.
